Facebook co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified before the Senate Judiciary and Senate Commerce Committees Tuesday to discuss the social media platform's policy on user privacy amid the Cambridge Analytica scandal.
The firm received a $15 million investment from Robert Mercer, a billionaire Republican donor, to influence voters, The New York Times reported.
The firm allegedly used a personality quiz to gather data from users and their friends, including details they had not intended to share.
They are also accused of using private information from at least 50 million Facebook users’ profiles to influence elections.
Cambridge Analytica is a political consulting firm that worked on then-candidate Donald Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign.
